lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
public static void main(String[] args) throws DukeException {
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
* A base class for self-defined exceptions
* Thrown when user did not give a description for the task
*         System.out.printf("     ☹ OOPS!!! The description of a %s cannot be empty.\n", taskType);
* Thrown when the task list is empty
*         System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, the list is empty ^_^");
* Thrown when there is problem saving the current task list
*         System.out.println("     OOPS!!! Exception caught while saving >_<|||");
* Thrown when failed to identify task, either given wrong information or task does not exist.
*         System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, please key in by Tasks.Task ID instead of [%s]", message);
* Thrown when date-time not given for deadline/event task.
*         System.out.println("     ☹ HEY!!! Please give a due date for deadlines and events. Let's have some sense of time");
* Thrown when user input does not categorize under any of the pre-defined message.
*      System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
private static ReturnMessages returnMessage = new ReturnMessages();
* @param taskList the full task list for saving purpose
public boolean execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage){
* @param taskList gets the full task list
public  void reply(TaskList taskList) throws EmptyTaskListException, UnknownSyntaxException, TaskNotFoundException {
System.out.println("     Now you have " + taskList.getListSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Function Overloading for execution of bye command
* @param taskList the full task list for saving purpose
public boolean execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* Function Overloading for execution of deadline command

public boolean execute(TaskList taskList, UI ui, Storage storage) {

* @param fileName   the file saving the information of task list
this.file = new File(System.getProperty("user.dir") + "/src/main/java/Duke.Storage/"+fileName); // create a File for the given file path
* Loads the information pre-stored in the file or saved on last exit.
* @exception DukeException Throws a general Duke Exception with Message Self-defined
* Creates File if first time initializing
* @exception  IOException throws a IO Exception if file exists

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X

return (isDone ? DONE : UNDONE); // mark done task with 1

System.out.println("     Now you have " + this.listSize + " tasks in the list.");

System.out.println("     Here are the tasks in your list:");

System.out.println("     Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("     Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("    What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("    Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

System.out.printf("     OOPS!!! The description of a %s cannot be empty.\n", taskType);

System.out.printf("     OOPS!!! Please key in by Tasks.Task ID instead of [%s]\n", message);
* Feedback message on noTimeConcept Exception thrown
System.out.println("     HEY!!! Please give a due date for deadlines and events. Let's have some sense of time >_<|||");
* Feedback message on Saving Exception thrown
System.out.println("     OOPS!!! Exception caught while saving >_<|||");
* Feedback message on Loading Exception thrown
System.out.println("     OOPS!!! Something went wrong while loading");
